TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StrokeCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> implements class System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged, class System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"> objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The StrokeCollection enables you to perform functions such as hit testing, clipping, and erasing strokes. The control performs many of these functions, but if you need more control than the provides, the StrokeCollection offers more options. The following table lists where to learn about managing digital ink on a custom control. |To do this…|See this article| |-----------------|----------------------| |Create a control that collects digital ink|[Creating an Ink Input Control](../Topic/Creating%20an%20Ink%20Input%20Control.md)| |Create a control that enables the user to select ink|[How to: Select Ink from a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Select%20Ink%20from%20a%20Custom%20Control.md)| |Create a control that enables the user to point-erase ink|[How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Erase%20Ink%20on%20a%20Custom%20Control.md)| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Object Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values |Term|Definition| |----------|----------------| ||A string that represents the stroke in base-64, encoded Ink Serialized Format (ISF).| ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy the ink in one onto another . This example assumes: - There are two objects called `inkCanvas1` and `inkCanvas2`. - The event has been connected to the event handler. [!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#21)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#21)]

Docs.param: The strokes to add to the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> class that contains the specified strokes.

MemberSignature.Value: public StrokeCollection (System.IO.Stream stream);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.param: A stream that contains ink data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> from the specified <xref:System.IO.Stream> of Ink Serialized Format (ISF).

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to save and load a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#10](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#10)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#10](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#10)] [!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#11](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#11)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#11](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#11)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection strokes);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection strokes) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified strokes to the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Add method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy the ink in one <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> onto another <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. This example assumes:
- There are two <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> objects called `inkCanvas1` and `inkCanvas2`.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click> event has been connected to the event handler.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#21)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#21)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPropertyData (Guid propertyDataId, object propertyData);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPropertyData(valuetype System.Guid propertyDataId, object propertyData) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Guid"> to associate with the custom property.

The value of the custom property. must be of type <see cref="T:System.Char">, <xref:System.Byte>,<xref:System.Int16>,,<xref:System.UInt16>, <xref:System.Int32>, <xref:System.UInt32>, <xref:System.Int64>, <xref:System.UInt64>, <xref:System.Single>, <xref:System.Double>, <xref:System.DateTime>, <xref:System.Boolean>, <xref:System.String>, <xref:System.Decimal> or an array of these data types, except <xref:System.String>, which is not allowed.
Docs.summary: Adds a custom property to the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AddPropertyData method enables you to add custom properties to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. You can then include extra information with a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to add and get custom property data. The `AddTimeStamp_Click` method uses the AddPropertyData method to add the current time to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. The `GetTimeStap_Click` method uses the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.GetPropertyData%2A> method to retrieve the timestamp from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#12)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#12)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed void ClearItems ();
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ClearItems() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears all strokes from the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Clip (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints);
.method public hidebysig instance void Clip(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Drawing.Point> that specifies the area to be clipped.
Docs.summary: Removes all strokes in the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> that are outside the bounds of the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Point> array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Clip method connects the first and last points in to create the lasso.
The Clip method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it clips.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to clip the strokes in a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#13](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#13)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#13](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#13)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Clip (System.Windows.Rect bounds);
.method public hidebysig instance void Clip(valuetype System.Windows.Rect bounds) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that specifies the area to be clipped.
Docs.summary: Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the specified rectangle with new strokes that do not extend beyond the specified rectangle.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All strokes that are entirely outside the specified rectangle are removed.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to erase the ink that is outside the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Rect>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#35](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#35)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#35](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#35)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection Clone ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Clone method copies each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> in the collection and the new <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> references the new strokes.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy the ink in one <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> onto another <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. This example assumes:
- There are two <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> objects called `inkCanvas1` and `inkCanvas2.`
- The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click> event has been connected to the event handler.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#21)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#21](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#21)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ContainsPropertyData (Guid propertyDataId);
.method public hidebysig instance bool ContainsPropertyData(valuetype System.Guid propertyDataId) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Guid"> to locate in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
Docs.summary: Returns whether the specified custom property identifier is in the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified custom property identifier is in the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to check for custom property in a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. If a custom property has been associated with `timestamp`, the example gets that custom property and shows when the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> was saved. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#12)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#12)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Draw (System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext context);
.method public hidebysig instance void Draw(class System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"> on which to draw the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
Docs.summary: Draws the strokes in the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a custom element that displays a thumbnail view of an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. The custom element keeps a reference to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> and redraws itself when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeCollected> event occurs.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#33](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window3.xaml.cs#33)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#33](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window3.xaml.vb#33)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Erase (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints);
.method public hidebysig instance void Erase(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Drawing.Point> that specifies the area to be erased.
Docs.summary: Removes the ink that is within the bounds of the specified area.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Erase method connects the first and last points in to create the lasso.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the Erase method is called. For example, if the specified area is through the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes.
The Erase method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to erase strokes in a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#2)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Erase (System.Windows.Rect bounds);
.method public hidebysig instance void Erase(valuetype System.Windows.Rect bounds) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that specifies the area to be erased.
Docs.summary: Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the specified rectangle with new strokes that do not enter the bounds of the specified rectangle.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the Erase method is called. For example, if the specified area is through the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes. All strokes that are entirely inside the specified rectangle are removed.
The Erase method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to erase the ink within the <xref:System.Windows.Rect>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#34](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#34)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#34](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#34)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Erase (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Point> eraserPath, System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape eraserShape);
.method public hidebysig instance void Erase(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Point> eraserPath, class System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape eraserShape) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Windows.Point> that specifies the path to be erased.
A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"> that specifies the shape of the eraser.
Docs.summary: Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the region created by the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"> along the specified path with new Strokes that are not clipped by the region.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the Erase method is called. For example, if intersects the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes.
The Erase method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to erase ink along a specific path. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#14](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#14)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#14](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#14)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Rect GetBounds ();
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Windows.Rect GetBounds() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the bounds of the strokes in the collection.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that contains the bounds of the strokes in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetBounds method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that takes the appearance of the rendered <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. For example, if <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is 10 display independent pixels (DIP) wide, the <xref:System.Windows.Rect> includes the entire width of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> and draw them on the control. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#20](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#20)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#20](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#20)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester GetIncrementalLassoHitTester (int percentageWithinLasso);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester GetIncrementalLassoHitTester(int32 percentageWithinLasso) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum percentage of each <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"> that must be contained within the lasso for it to be considered hit.
Docs.summary: Creates an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester"> that hit tests the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> with a lasso (freehand) path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetIncrementalLassoHitTester method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester> that considers a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> to be "hit" when the lasso path surrounds it. This is useful for implementing features, such as the ability to select a stroke with a lasso tool. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> uses an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester> to implement the lasso selection tool.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester> that enables a user to select strokes with a lasso tool. To create a control that enables a user to select ink, see [How to: Select Ink from a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Select%20Ink%20from%20a%20Custom%20Control.md).
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#17](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/InkSelector.cs#17)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#17](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/InkSelector.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester GetIncrementalStrokeHitTester (System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape eraserShape);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester GetIncrementalStrokeHitTester(class System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape eraserShape) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"> that specifies the tip of the stylus.
Docs.summary: Creates an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester"> that hit tests the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> with an erasing path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetIncrementalStrokeHitTester method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> that considers a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> to be "hit" when the eraser path intersects it. This is useful for implementing features, such as the ability to erase part of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> uses an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> that can be used to erase part of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. To create a control that enables a user to erase ink, see [How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Erase%20Ink%20on%20a%20Custom%20Control.md).
[!code-cs[InkEraser#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/MyInkEraser/InkEraser.cs#4)] [!code-vb[InkEraser#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/MyInkEraser/InkEraser.vb#4)]

.method public hidebysig instance object GetPropertyData(valuetype System.Guid propertyDataId) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Guid"> associated with the custom property to get.
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the custom property associated with the specified <see cref="T:System.Guid">.
Docs.returns: The value of the custom property associated with the specified <see cref="T:System.Guid">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.AddPropertyData%2A> and GetPropertyData methods enable you to add custom properties to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. You can then include extra information with a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to add and get custom property data. The `AddTimeStamp_Click` method uses the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.AddPropertyData%2A> method to add the current time to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. The `GetTimeStap_Click` method uses the GetPropertyData method to retrieve the timestamp from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#12)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#12](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#12)]

Docs.summary: Returns the GUIDs of any custom properties associated with the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.
Docs.returns: An array of type <see cref="T:System.Guid"> that represent the custom property identifiers.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get the custom property identifiers from the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#27](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#27)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#27](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#27)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints, int percentageWithinLasso);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Point> lassoPoints, int32 percentageWithinLasso) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Windows.Point> that represents the bounds of the area to be hit tested.
The acceptable length of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke">, as a percentage, for to contain.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of strokes that have at least the specified percentage of length within the specified area.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> that has strokes with at least the specified percentage within the <xref:System.Windows.Point> array.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to remove all strokes that are at least 80 percent within the specified lasso from a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This is useful when a custom control enables the user to select ink with a lasso. To create a control that enables a user to select ink with a lasso, see [How to: Select Ink from a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Select%20Ink%20from%20a%20Custom%20Control.md).
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#16](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#16)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#16](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#16)]

Docs.param: An array to type <xref:System.Windows.Point> that represents the path to be hit tested.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"> that specifies the shape of .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of strokes that intersect with the specified path.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> of strokes that intersect with .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example changes the color of all the strokes that intersect the path that is created by the <xref:System.Windows.Point> array. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest (System.Windows.Point point, double diameter);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest(valuetype System.Windows.Point point, float64 diameter) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Windows.Point> to hit test.
The size of the area around the <xref:System.Windows.Point> to hit test.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of strokes that intersect the specified area.
Docs.returns: A collection of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"> objects that intersect the specified point.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get the strokes that intersect the specified <xref:System.Windows.Point>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#15](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#15)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#15](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest (System.Windows.Rect bounds, int percentageWithinBounds);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection HitTest(valuetype System.Windows.Rect bounds, int32 percentageWithinBounds) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that specifies the bounds to be hit tested.
The minimum required length of a Stroke that must exist within bounds for it to be considered hit.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of strokes that have at least the specified percentage of length within the specified rectangle.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> that has strokes with at least the specified percentage within the <xref:System.Windows.Rect>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example erases the strokes that are at least 50% within the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Rect>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#36](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#36)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#36](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#36)]

MemberSignature.Value: public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Ink.Stroke stroke);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Ink.Stroke stroke) cil managed

Docs.param: The stroke whose position is required.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"> in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IndexOf method returns -1 if is not a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly string InkSerializedFormat;
.field public static initonly string InkSerializedFormat

Docs.summary: Represents the native persistence format for ink data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the InkSerializedFormat field to specify the format of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> when you transfer data, such as when you copy the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> to the Clipboard.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> to the Clipboard. The example specifies that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> is in Ink Serialized Format (ISF), so that other programs, such as Microsoft Office Word can accept the copied data.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#5](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#5)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#5](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#5)]

The specified stroke

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnStrokesChanged (System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnStrokesChanged(class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventArgs"> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the <see cref="E:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged"> event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The OnStrokesChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate, which is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public event System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventHandler PropertyDataChanged;
.event class System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventHandler PropertyDataChanged

Docs.summary: Occurs when custom property is added or removed from the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to handle the PropertyDataChanged event. This example assumes that there is a <xref:System.Guid> called `dateTimeGuid` and the PropertyDataChanged event is connected to the event handler defined in this example.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#29](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#29)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#29](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#29)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Remove (System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection strokes);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection strokes) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified strokes from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Remove method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it removes.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to remove all strokes that are at least 80 percent within the specified lasso from a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This is useful when a custom control enables the user to select ink with a lasso. To create a control that enables a user to select ink with a lasso, see [How to: Select Ink from a Custom Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Select%20Ink%20from%20a%20Custom%20Control.md).
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#16](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.cs#16)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#16](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/StrokeCollectionDemo.vb#16)]

Docs.summary: Removes the stroke at the specified index from the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

The source <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

## Remarks The Replace method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event.

The source <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">.

## Remarks The Replace method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it replaces.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to replace the selected strokes on an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> with another <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.

.method public hidebysig instance void Save(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.IO.Stream"> to which to save the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
Docs.summary: Saves the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"> to the specified <xref:System.IO.Stream>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Save method saves the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> as Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to save a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> to a file by using the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Save%28System.IO.Stream%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.

`true` to compress the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection">; otherwise, `false`.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Save%2A> method saves the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> as Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to save a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> to a file by using the Save method. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.

MemberSignature.Value: public event System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventHandler StrokesChanged;
.event class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventHandler StrokesChanged

Docs.summary: Occurs when a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"> in the collection changes.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example adds the current time as a custom property to each new stroke in the StrokesChanged event handler. The example assumes that the StrokesChanged event is connected to the event handler defined in this example.
[!code-cs[DrawingAttributes#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/DrawingAttributesSample/Window1.xaml.cs#4)] [!code-vb[DrawingAttributes#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/DrawingAttributesSample/Window1.xaml.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Transform (System.Windows.Media.Matrix transformMatrix, bool applyToStylusTip);
.method public hidebysig instance void Transform(valuetype System.Windows.Media.Matrix transformMatrix, bool applyToStylusTip) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> which specifies the transformation to perform on the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
`true` to apply the transformation to the tip of the stylus; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Modifies each of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> and optionally the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform%2A> for each stroke in the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> according to the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When is `true`, the Transform method affects the shape of the stylus tip, as well as the position of the strokes. For example, if you rotate a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> 90 degrees, the strokes move around an axis and the height and width of the strokes appear to be inverted.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to move all the strokes on an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkCanvas1`.
[!code-cs[StrokeCollectionMethods#9](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.cs#9)] [!code-vb[StrokeCollectionMethods#9](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/StrokeCollectionMethods/Window2.xaml.vb#9)]
